meanings.definition: To live or spend a period of time in a dull, inactive, or unchallenging way.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his homework, he decided to vegetate on the couch and watch TV.
meanings.sent2: During the weekend, I like to vegetate and relax without any stress.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to vegetate lazily in the sun, enjoying the warmth.
meanings.sent4: Her mind started to vegetate like a neglected garden, lacking stimulation.
meanings.sent5: The room was so peaceful, it almost felt like a place to vegetate and unwind.

meanings.definition: To grow or sprout as a plant.
meanings.sent1: The seeds will vegetate in the soil and eventually turn into beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: In spring, the garden starts to vegetate with new green shoots emerging.
meanings.sent3: The plant seemed to vegetate happily in the sunlight, reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent4: The idea began to vegetate in her mind, slowly taking root and growing.
meanings.sent5: The forest floor was covered with seeds ready to vegetate and become part of the ecosystem.
